comments.body: Why do you expect Django to run all three views from one url pattern? Django only runs the first matched url pattern.
Yes, because I want them to render on the same page. When I alter the urls I am left with three different urls instead of one.
So basically you want to render the values in the same template? You can add the values to the context in a single view. Is that what you want? I'd be better to clarify that on your quesiton
Yes that is exactly what I want to do and I have already mentioned it in my question.

answers.body:
You need to have different paths for your urls. That's why it's not working. You have the same path to all of them.

views.py

def chart(request):
    #fusionchart code
    context = {
        'output' : column2D.render(),
        'output2' : doughnut3d.render(),
        'output3' : area2D.render(),
        'today': today,
        'mapbox_access_token': mapbox_access_token
    }
    return  render(request, 'dash.html', context)

urls.py

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^$', views.chart, name='chart'),
]

title: Django view only renders first URL
body:
I have the following code in my Django applicaton:

View.py

def Chart(request):
#fusionchart code
    return  render(request, 'dash.html', {'output' : column2D.render(),'output2' : doughnut3d.render(),'output3' : area2D.render()})


def view_name(request):
#calculation code
    return render(request, 'dash.html', {'today': today})

def default_map(request):
#map built code
    return render(request, 'dash.html', 
                  { 'mapbox_access_token': mapbox_access_token })

url.py

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^$', views.Chart, name = 'Chart'),
    url(r'^$', views.view_name, name = 'view_name'),
    url(r'^$', views.default_map, name="default"),  
]

The issue that I am currently having is that the urlpatterns only show/render what is done in the first def (in this case def Chart) and skip the other two defs.

How can I make sure that Django takes into account all three defs and renders all three of them on the same page?
